section.name: Carmen Mini
section.definition: This is a convenience section that lists the terms of the CARMEN MINI (Gibson et al. Nature Precedings, 2009 Version 0.6) and maps them to the odml "standard" terminologies.

property.name: DateAndTime
property.definition: The date and time of work initiation in YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss format. (TODO ISO 8601 requires the T lib has to able to deal with it!)

property.name: ResponsiblePerson
property.definition: The (stable) primary contact person for this data set; this could be the experimenter, lab head, line manager etc. Where responsibility rests with an institutional role (e.g. one of a number of duty officers) rather than a person, give the official name of the role rather than any one person. In all cases give affiliation and stable contact information, which consists of (i) Name, (ii) Postal address and (iii) Email address.

property.name: ExperimentalContext
property.definition: The name of the project, study or wider investigation of which the 'experiment' is a part (if appropriate).

property.name: ElectrophysiologyType
property.definition: The type of electrophysiology recording reported as 'extra cellular' or 'intra cellular'.

property.name: Genus
property.definition: The genus classification of the study subject according to the NCBI taxonomy classification.

property.name: Species
property.definition: The species classification of the study subject according to the NCBI taxonomy classification.

property.name: Strain
property.definition: The strain, genetic variation classification of the study subject, if appropriate. Note this is not the cell line.

property.name: CellLine
property.definition: The identifier for the immortalized cell line, if appropriate.

property.name: GeneticCharacteristics
property.definition: The genotype of the study stubject. Genetics characteristics include polymorphisms, disease alleles and haplotypes.

property.name: GeneticVariation
property.definition: The genetic modification introduced in addition to strain, if appropriate.

property.name: DeseaseState
property.definition: The name of the pathology diagnosed in the subject. The disease state is 'normal' if no disease state has been diagnosed.

property.name: ClinicalInformation
property.definition: A link, summary or reference to additional clinical information, if appropriate.

property.name: Sex
property.definition: The sex of the subject, in terms of either male, female or hermaphrodite.

property.name: Age
property.definition: The time period elapsed since an identifiable point in the life cycle of an organism. If a developmental stage is specified the indentifiable point would be the beginning of that stage. Otherwise the identifiable point must be specifies. For example, 2 hours post surgery.

property.name: DevelopmentalStage
property.definition: The developmental stage of the of the study subect's life cycle.

property.name: SubjectLabel
property.definition: If the subject has been chemically labeled or stained; state the label name.

property.name: SubjectIdentifier
property.definition: The type and value of the identifier assigned to the subject.

property.name: SubjectIdentifierType
property.definition: The type and value of the identifier assigned to the subject. For example, vendor or patient identifier. For patients, the identifier must be approved by an Institutional Review Board or appropriate body.

property.name: SubjectIdentifierValue
property.definition: The unique string which corresponds to the identifier type. TODO! How does this relate to the Identifier ?

property.name: AssociatedSubjectDetails
property.definition: The organisation (e.g vendor) or individual responsible for the subject.

property.name: PreparationProtocol
property.definition: The surgical procedure or the preparation protocol implemented to obtain the specific sample for recording.

property.name: PreparationDate
property.definition: The date the surgical procedure or the preparation protocol was performed to obtain the specific sample for recording. Given in the ISO:8601 representation. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss

property.name: LocationStructure
property.definition: The anatomical part or structure of the subject under investigation or recorded from. For example brain or cell culture.

property.name: BrainArea
property.definition: If the anatomical structure under study from 3.(a) is the brain then state the location. If the anatomical structure under study is the mammalian brain then state the location using Neuronames. (http://braininfo.rprc.washington.edu/aboutfolder/aboutbi.html).

property.name: SliceThickness
property.definition: The thickness of the recording slice in milimeters.

property.name: SliceOrientation
property.definition: State the planes of the slice, in terms of either i) coronal (widthways), ii) saggital (lengthways parallel to midline) or iii) tangential (lengthways perpendicular to midline).

property.name: CellType
property.definition: The cell type of the anatomical structure given in 3.(a) under investigation if non mixed. If mixed the target cell type should be provided.

property.name: TargetCellType
property.definition: The cell type of the anatomical structure given in 3.(a) under investigation if non mixed. If mixed the target cell type should be provided

property.name: ConfirmedCellType
property.definition: The method of coordinate assignment given in 2.3.1. Reported as 'anatomy confirmation', 'estimation' or chemical label (this includes antibodies and staining). The label used should be reported in section 2.(l). Additional information such as recordings or image files which also confirm the location can be referenced here.

property.name: Protocol
property.definition: A description of the task protocol undertaken by the subject.

property.name: SensoryConditions
property.definition: The sensory conditions during the task protocol.

property.name: Equipment
property.definition: The Model Name, Model Number and Manufacturer for equipment used in the task protocol.

property.name: Recording
property.definition: If the task is recorded state how and what data types are being recorded.

property.name: Protocol
property.definition: A description of the stimulus protocol undertaken by the subject.

property.name: SensoryConditions
property.definition: The sensory conditions during the stimulus protocol.

property.name: Solutions
property.definition: Description of the solutions used in terms of name, components with concentrations,(if appropriate).

property.name: Equipment
property.definition: The Model Name, Model Number and Manufacturer for specialised equipment used during the stimulus protocol. If electrode(s) are used then they should be described following the structure presented in ref x.x

property.name: Recording
property.definition: If the stimulus is recorded state how and what data types are being recorded.

property.name: Event
property.definition: A description of the behavioural event observed.

property.name: Equipment
property.definition: The equipment use to record the behavioural event, if recorded in terms of The Model Name, Model Number and Manufacturer.

property.name: BehaviouralEventRecording
property.definition: The type of recording of the behavioural event, the file format and the format encoding.

property.name: Protocol
property.definition: A description of the recording protocol.

property.name: Conditions
property.definition: The subject conditions during the recording. Invivo or invitro preparation If invivo was it anethesitised or awake? If awake what was the stimulus condition.

property.name: ContainingDevice
property.definition: Containing device temperature of the subject or sample (for example, a bath): Include temperature if appropriate.

property.name: Solutions
property.definition: Description of the solutions used in terms of name, components with concentrations,(if appropriate).

property.name: SolutionFlowSpeed
property.definition: The flow speed of the solution described in (ref x.x) in terms of ml/min.

property.name: Electrode
property.definition: The type of electrode and the Model Name, Model Number and Manufacturer for specialised equipment.

property.name: ElectrodeConfiguration
property.definition: The configuration or arrangement of the electrode. For example, a 2-dimensional array. Also state the distance between each electrode. If the study uses voltage clamp in a patch configuration, state the access resistance (the resistance of the cell membrane, which is in series with the electrode resistance).

property.name: ElectrodeImpedance
property.definition: The electrode range or impedance of the electrode.

property.name: Amplifier
property.definition: The Model Name, Model Number and Manufacturer of the amplifier.

property.name: Filter
property.definition: The Model Name, Model Number and Manufacturer of the filter.

property.name: FilterSettings
property.definition: The settings or the parameters of the filter.

property.name: Recorder
property.definition: The Model Name, Model Number and Manufacturer of the recorder.

property.name: DataFormat
property.definition: The name of the data format of the time series data and specific encoding. For example, ASCII or binary encoding.

property.name: SamplingRate
property.definition: The sampling rate of the recording.

property.name: FileLocation
property.definition: The time series file location should be made available when the experiment is published, for example, using a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) or a Digital Object Identifier (DOI). (Note this will be achieved automatically via submission to the CARMEN system).
